title: John Garamendi - Ballotpedia
snippet: John Garamendi (Democratic Party) is a member of the U.S. House, representing California's 8th Congressional District. He assumed office on January 3, 2023. His current term ends on January 3, 2027.

snippet: H.R.5599 — 119th Congress (2025-2026) To prohibit the removal of Federal employees during any lapse in discretionary appropriations, and for other purposes. Sponsor: Olszewski, Johnny [Rep.-D-MD-2] (Introduced 09/26/2025) Cosponsors: (72) Committees: House - Oversight and Government Reform Latest Action: House - 09/26/2025 Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform.

title: John Garamendi - Wikipedia
snippet: In the general election, he defeated Republican Wes Bannister, 52% to 38%. In fact, he was so confident of winning that he resigned his state senate seat early to give an advantage to his wife Patti, over her top rival for the seat, assemblyman Patrick Johnston (D-Stockton) for the upcoming special election to replace him. In 1991, while serving as California Insurance Commissioner, Garamendi seized Executive Life, a failing life insurance company, and resold it to French investors who turned out to be fronts for a government-owned French bank.

title: Rep. John Garamendi [D-CA8, 2023-2026], Representative for California's 8th Congressional District - GovTrack.us
snippet: Analysis and Commentary Nov. 9, 2025: The Government Shutdown at Day 40: Where are we and how did we get here? » ... Garamendi is the representative for California’s 8th congressional district (view map) and is a Democrat. He has served since Jan. 3, 2023.
